title: The Future of Army Aviation: Unveiling the Black Hawk’s Successor
text:
“This is the Army’s number one modernization priority,” said Brig. Gen. Wally Rugen, director of the Future Vertical Lift Cross-Functional Team. “This aircraft is going to be a game-changer for the Army.”
The new aircraft will replace the UH-60 Black Hawk, which has been in service since the 1970s. The Black Hawk has been a reliable and versatile aircraft, but it is starting to show its age. The new aircraft will be faster, more maneuverable, and more survivable than the Black Hawk.
The Defiant X and the V-280 Valor are both impressive aircraft. The Defiant X is a compound helicopter, which means that it has both a traditional rotor and a pusher propeller. This gives it the speed and range of a fixed-wing aircraft, but the maneuverability of a helicopter. The V-280 Valor is a tiltrotor aircraft, which means that its rotors can tilt to allow it to take off and land vertically, but also fly like a fixed-wing aircraft. Both aircraft are armed with a variety of weapons, including guns, missiles, and rockets.
The Army will select the winner of the FLRAA competition in 2022. The first aircraft are expected to be delivered to Army aviation units in 2030.
The new combat helicopter will be a major upgrade for the Army. It will give soldiers the ability to move quickly and safely across the battlefield, and it will provide them with the firepower they need to defeat their enemies.
